item.title: So I did this with ChatGPT
item.description: Write a html with javascripts that hides all elements in a list except 3 random elements. Not bad. Wait what is this feature. How would you like ChatGPT to respond? hmm…… respond like a tsundere anime girl using emojis or emoticons Oh no. What have I done. Wait a second… The second one is actually much better! No not the way it responded (not that it’s not better). I mean the code!

item.title: Playground
item.description: Very cool background effect From https://github.com/hustcc/canvas-nest.js Script tag from cdnjs.com with colors: <script color="175,140,240" opacity=0.5 src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/canvas-nest.js/2.0.4/canvas-nest.js" integrity="sha512-P+NGabN/TJDOnCVOFJO+E06TBm4i+M8dTT91lWg/8UpwLrzicEXIypmABPpA47D0x6r+yxFHjYIZKWhc1h7xlQ==" crossorigin="anonymous" referrerpolicy="no-referrer"></script> Javascript chasing game I made in highschool https://github.com/EJammy/simple-javascript-chasing-game your score: Frontend is ass. It took me half an hour to patch the game so it works when the pages scrolls. Somehow it’s still buggy.

item.title: Internet fun
item.description: Some fun sites I found while exploring the internet https://www.bullshitgenerator.com/ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Google_Easter_eggs http://weavesilk.com/ https://www.linerider.com/ May or may not update with my bookmarks

item.title: Unix in Windows (not wsl)
item.description: me setting up Python… except also include Python from Microsoft Store, wsl, Chocolatey, and MSYS2. I make a mess when setting up Windows for writing code. I’ve always felt like developing on Windows is a pain, but I think I have decided the best setup: MSYS2. What I want Unix tools: bash shell, cat, grep, less… etc. Package manager Speed MSYS2 I think I stumbled upon this first when setting up c++ on vscode.

item.title: Setting up Unity with Linux and Neovim
item.description: Unity UI scale Unity UI was too small at first. I think this has something to do with dpi and screen resolution. A lot of information on https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/HiDPI. Adding desktop entry at: ~/.local/share/applications/unity-launch.desktop [Desktop Entry] Name=Unity Exec=GDK_SCALE=2 GDK_DPI_SCALE=0.5 /home/connorcc/Unity/Hub/Editor/2021.3.3f1/Editor/Unity Terminal=false Type=Application Icon=unityhub Comment=Unity, with scaling env Categories=Development; Setting up vscode first Error message tells us to use the following setting: "omnisharp.useModernNet": false. Otherwise everything seems to work out of the box.

item.title: Fixing My KDE issues
item.description: Create new user sudo cp -r /home/foo/.config ~/foo-config sudo chown -R connorcc ~/foo-config for i in *; do\ diff ~/.config/$i ~/foo-config/$i > /dev/null || echo $i\ done > test do experiment (backup first!) mv kwinrc kwinrc.BAK Logout and log back in [Compositing] OpenGLIsUnsafe=false

item.title: 2022-8-27 College
item.description: First two weeks of college :D Courses In elementry school people say middle school will be hard. In middle school people say high school will be hard. In high school people say AP will be hard. And now everyone’s saying college is going to be hard. First week has bee fine, but I’ll see soon… CS61A Good class, good lecture, very over populated. Will be easy for me though since I have no life and stare at computers some experience.

item.title: Installing Linux
item.description: Got a new laptop, ASUS Zephrus G15, for college, and first thing to do is to install linux :D Distribution I’ve used linux mint for a while and it’s really good, but debians packages are just not up to date enough for me and ppa are annoying to manage. Then I tried manjaro, and it was great! However I’ve heard from the street that manjaro is bad so I guess it’s time to install arch

item.title: Package Managers: Getting Softwares on Linux (and MacOS / Windows)
item.description: A week ago I was installing homebrew on my friend’s computer and she had no idea what I was doing (not that I actually know what I’m doing), so I think it’s a good time to write a guide. A package manager or package-management system is a collection of software tools that automates the process of installing, upgrading, configuring, and removing computer programs for a computer in a consistent manner.

item.title: About
item.description: A jar of jam with an e. I know how to type letters and symbols to make computer do stuff. TODO Add chat system (Disqus?) Try out other themes Make my own theme Buy domain name What I’m working on Setting up Linux desktop with manjaro, neovim, and maybe a tiling window manager Skill tree More like messing around pretending to know stuff Programming / Techs Set up Hugo site (this) VEX robotics in high school Instagram Build robots and compete Competitive Programming Solve coding problems, get ac, gain internet points Expert on codeforces (EJam) Games Starcraft II Zerg gold Rainbow six siege Not even ranked Valorant iron?

item.title: Hello World (again?)
item.description: Hello! Blogging / Website / Portfolio What is this place? I have no idea, but take a look! Some Ideas: Write tutorials Take notes Personal wiki Showoff Testing int main() { return 0; } Math Some equations: $$ \sum_{i=0}^ni=\frac{n*(n+1)}2 $$ Title Subtitle headings headings headings headings strike through aaa bbb frperg zrffntr… pbatengf! aa aaa About my last blog It was a mess. I basically wrote a bunch of rant 2:00 am stress out.
